intro: Chuquiraga vepreculata, commonly known as the Andean burweed, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are surrounded by bracts, and it has a sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and leaves. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Chuquiraga vepreculata is adapted to withstand cold temperatures and strong winds typical of its mountainous habitat.
